title: Nine arrested in murder probe over far-right activist's death in Lyon
subhead: A parliamentary aide from the radical-left party La France Insoumise was among those arrested over the fatal beating of Quentin Deranque, a 23-year-old far-right activist.

title: France and Algeria agree to resume security cooperation
In Kyiv, a fourth winter of war spares no one
Paul Magnette, political scientist: 'If Trump and his friends were truly convinced of their superiority, would they spend so much time trying to divide Europeans?'
subhead: Rather than bemoan their dependence on the United States, European Union member states should defend their federal and democratic system and strive for greater autonomy, argues the president of Belgium's French-speaking Socialist Party, in this opinion piece for Le Monde.

title: Snow camping at ski resorts: 'Our friends think we're crazy'
subhead: Although many have disappeared, 'caravaneige' campsites – those that welcome campers and caravans in the snow – are still enjoying good times at high altitudes, driven by a new generation of skiing campers and their unbeatable prices.

title: In an open letter, dozens of film figures slam Berlin Film Festival 'silence' on Gaza
subhead: The statement, published on Tuesday, came after the Berlinale's jury president, German director Wim Wenders, answered a question on Gaza last week by saying: 'We cannot really enter the field of politics.' Signatories include Oscar-winning actors Javier Bardem and Tilda Swinton.

title: 'Marty Supreme,' with Timothée Chalamet: An existential and frenetic table tennis journey
subhead: Director and screenwriter Josh Safdie, now working apart from his brother Benny, gives the 'Dune' star the standout role of his career as a brash table tennis player inspired by Marty Reisman.

At Navalny's grave, two years after his death in a Russian prison: 'We are not alone'
subhead: Several hundred supporters of the Kremlin's most renowned opponent gathered on Monday at the Moscow cemetery where he is buried. A new investigation confirmed the cause of his death: assassination by poisoning.

title: The Epstein case: Thirty years of judicial negligence, at the expense of victims
subhead: The first complaints against the millionaire date back to 1996. Yet between his initial conviction in 2008 and his arrest in the summer of 2019, he was never troubled by the justice system.

title: French music festivals to book for late winter and early spring
subhead: Electronic music, rock, chanson française, hip-hop... From Paris to Marseille, via Saint-Malo or Caen, the French festival scene offers an abundance of options sure to satisfy every musical taste.
